snippet: Will the ride-sharing service succeed because of network effects, or merely clear out regulatory obstacles to the ultimate benefit of others?
abstract: Future of Uber, the rapidly growing transportation app, revolves around whether company will benefit from so-called network effects--the increasing value of a service as it is adopted by more and more users; while Uber is widely expected to win regulatory battles in several markets, it remains to be seen whether they will reap benefits themselves or fall prey to competition.
lead_paragraph: Will the ride-sharing service succeed because of network effects, or merely clear out regulatory obstacles to the ultimate benefit of others?

headline.main: Can Uber Live Up to Its $40 Billion Valuation?
headline.print_headline: Can Uber Live Up to Its $41 Billion Valuation?
